content: cccrrroooccchhheeettt cccaaabbbllleee cccooovvveeerrr i ve seen many gorgeous cabled knitted hot water bottle covers which i can t make as i can barely knit so i set myself the task of crocheting one the hot water bottle cover measures approximately 36 cm 14 inches by 22 cm 9 inches including the neck i left the bottom edge completely open so it s easy to put the bottle in and then i threaded a ribbon through the 1st row of double_crochet to secure it you could also sew some buttons on and use the gaps between the stitches as buttonholes whatever takes your fancy yarn rowan pure wool aran 100g x 2 notions 1m of 6mm wide ribbon or 2-3 buttons approximately 20mm diameter hook 6 5mm skill intermediate gauge 4 inches = 11 sts and 7 row of double_crochet special stitches front post triple crochet and back post triple crochet lefties please go to the end of the pdf for explanation and pictures fptc bptc 1 yarn over twice 1 yarn over twice 2 instead of 2 take the crochet inserting the hook hook to the back of into the stitch insert your work t he hook from right t o left behind the 3 insert hook from stitch post right to left in front of the stitch post 3 yarn over and pull loop back behind the 4 yarn over and pull s titch post loop back in front the stitch post 4 complete the s titch as you would 5 complete the f or a normal triple triple as usual cccrrroooccchhheeettt cccaaabbbllleee cccooovvveeerrr abbreviations chain chain double_crochet double_crochet fptc front post triple crochet bptc back post triple crochet hot water bottle cover make 2 double chain chain 3 double_crochet into 3rd chain from hook * yarn over inserting hook under the bottom strand of previous double_crochet work 1 double_crochet * repeat from * to * until there are 24 stitches pictures for lefties can be found at the end of the document note the double chain produces a more flexible base chain than a normal chain and is easier to work into for the first row if you prefer you can use a normal base chain instead of the double chain chain 27 double_crochet into 4th chain from hook and each chain across to end 24 stitches row 1 chain 3 turn double_crochet into 2nd double_crochet of previous row double_crochet into each st across including the turning chain 24 stitches for each subsequent row the final stitch is made into the turning chain of the previous row row 2 chain 3 turn double_crochet into 2nd double_crochet of previous row double_crochet into next 3 sts fptc round post of next st double_crochet into next st fptc round post of next st double_crochet into next st fptc round post of next 6 sts double_crochet into next st fptc round post of next st double_crochet into next st fptc round post of next st double_crochet into next 5 sts
